agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Urban Affairs TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.010 CHAIR: Rep. Angie Button The Committee will meet to hear the following: HB 219 Reynolds Relating to requirements regarding a municipality's comprehensive plan for long-range development, including adoption of an environmental report. HB 224 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to a petition for a municipal animal control authority to manage dangerous dogs and aggressive dogs in the extraterritorial jurisdiction of the municipality. HB 984 Parker Relating to requirements for new or increased municipal fees. HB 1363 Wu Relating to the civil prosecution of offenses involving certain municipal parking ordinances; authorizing a civil fine. HB 1583 Neave | et al. Relating to the creation of a government shutdown housing relief loan program; authorizing fees. HB 2077 Metcalf Relating to the creation of the City of Conroe Municipal Management District No. 3; providing authority to issue bonds and impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 3254 Rodriguez Relating to low income housing tax credits awarded to supportive housing developments HB 3272 González, Jessica Relating to a right of first refusal applicable to the sale of housing developments that have received certain financial assistance administered by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs. HB 3347 Bucy Relating to the exemption of certain property from municipal drainage service charges. HB 3436 Sanford Relating to the creation of the Celina Municipal Management District No. 3; providing authority to issue bonds and impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 3969 Murr Relating to municipal regulation of structured sober living homes. HB 4081 Sanford Relating to the allocation of low income housing tax credits. HB 4464 Gervin-Hawkins Relating to a study on mold contamination in housing developments supported by financial assistance administered by the Texas Department of Housing and Community Affairs. HB 4470 Davis, Yvonne Relating to community development by municipal management districts in certain counties. HB 4637 Bonnen, Greg Relating to the creation of the City of Kemah Municipal Management District No. 1; providing a limited authority of eminent domain; providing authority to issue bonds and impose assessments, fees, and taxes. HB 4730 Moody Relating to the creation of the City of El Paso Municipal Management District No. 1; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, or taxes. HB 4733 González, Jessica Relating to the creation of the Oak Farms Municipal Management District; providing authority to issue bonds; providing authority to impose assessments, fees, and taxes. SB 674 Campbell Relating to authorizing an exemption for open-enrollment charter schools from certain municipal drainage requirements. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
